perturbation.original_text: "Fees" means the installation fees, licensing fees and support service fees owed by Reseller to TouchStar, as set forth on EXHIBIT A.
perturbation.changed_text: "Fees" means the installation fees owed by Reseller to TouchStar. The specific fees, licensing fees and support service fees may be determined at TouchStar's discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that the fees are 'as set forth on EXHIBIT A,' providing a clear reference point. The modified text introduces ambiguity by stating that the specific fees are determined 'at TouchStar's discretion,' contradicting the fixed fee structure and creating uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: 4.11 PERFORMANCE QUOTAS. Each Annual Marketing Plan developed by Reseller           during the term of this Agreement and any extension thereof shall           contain quotas mutually agreed between TouchStar and Reseller for the           sale by Reseller of TouchStar Software and Support Services in the           Territory for the year to which such Annual Marketing Plan relates           (the "Quotas"). Reseller acknowledges that meeting the Quotas is an           essential element of this Agreement and that this Agreement may be           terminated by TouchStar if, in TouchStar's reasonable opinion,           Reseller will not meet the Quotas during the Term or any extension           thereof.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.11 PERFORMANCE QUOTAS. Each Annual Marketing Plan developed by Reseller           during the term of this Agreement and any extension thereof shall           contain quotas proposed by Reseller. TouchStar may, at its sole discretion, accept or reject these quotas. Reseller's performance relative to these quotas will be considered, but will not be a strict condition for the continuation or termination of the agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states that the performance quotas are essential elements and are mutually agreed upon. The modified clause makes the quotas proposed by Reseller, which TouchStar may reject or accept. Furthermore, it states that whether or not the quotas are met is not a strict condition for the termination of the agreement. This introduces an internal contradiction, creating uncertainty about the quotas' significance and enforceability.

perturbation.original_text: 8.1  TERM OF AGREEMENT. This Agreement shall continue in force for a term           of twelve (12) months from the Effective Date, unless terminated           earlier under the provisions of this Article 8 (the "Term"); PROVIDED           that TouchStar shall have the right to terminate this Agreement at any           time after the Effective Date upon not less than fifteen (15) days'           prior written notice to Reseller.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.1  TERM OF AGREEMENT. This Agreement shall continue in force for a term that may not exceed twelve (12) months from the Effective Date, unless terminated           earlier under the provisions of this Article 8 (the "Term"); PROVIDED           that TouchStar shall have the right to terminate this Agreement at any time after the Effective Date with no prior written notice to Reseller.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a fixed term of 12 months with a 15-day notice period for termination by TouchStar. The modified text introduces the phrase 'may not exceed' regarding the 12-month term, suggesting a possible shorter term at TouchStar's discretion. It then removes the requirement for prior written notice for termination, directly contradicting the original provision. This creates uncertainty about the actual duration of the agreement and the conditions for termination.
